bug.author: ivsrihari
bug.description:
Hi, I am seeing following performance warning message from mkldnn.hpp when using visual studio 2015 compiler. Can you please fix this issue? mkldnn.hpp(707): warning C4800: 'int': forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning) In file mkldnn.h, below function returns int <denchmark-code>int MKLDNN_API mkldnn_memory_primitive_desc_equal( const_mkldnn_primitive_desc_t lhs, const_mkldnn_primitive_desc_t rhs); </denchmark-code>
In file mkldnn.hpp, below function expects bool to be returned, but gets int. <denchmark-code>bool operator==(const primitive_desc &other) const { return mkldnn_memory_primitive_desc_equal(get(), other.get()); </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Intel MKL-DNN includes hardware-specific optimizations and may behave differently on depending on the compiler and build environment. Include the following information to help reproduce the issue:
Compiler version - Visual Studio C++ 2015
Thanks, Srihari

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ivsrihari>@ivsrihari</denchmark-link> , Thanks for noticing this issue! We will fix it. Regards, Igor
